name: Pradhan Mantri Kisan Samman Nidhi
description: Income support scheme providing ₹6,000 per year in three equal installments to small and marginal farmer families with cultivable land.
ministry: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

benefits.amount: ₹6,000 per year in three installments of ₹2,000 each

application_process: Apply online through PM-KISAN portal or visit the nearest Common Service Centre (CSC). Verification is done by state and district level authorities.

name: Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act
name_hi: महात्मा गांधी राष्ट्रीय ग्रामीण रोजगार गारंटी अधिनियम
description: Guarantees 100 days of wage employment per year to every rural household whose adult members volunteer to do unskilled manual work.
ministry: Ministry of Rural Development

benefits.amount: 100 days of guaranteed wage employment at state-notified wage rates (₹200-₹350 per day depending on state)

application_process: Apply at the Gram Panchayat office for a Job Card. Once issued, submit a written application demanding work to the Gram Panchayat or Block office.

name: Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana - Gramin
description: Provides financial assistance to rural households living in kutcha or dilapidated houses for construction of pucca houses with basic amenities.
ministry: Ministry of Rural Development

benefits.amount: ₹1,20,000 in plain areas and ₹1,30,000 in hilly/difficult/IAP areas for house construction

application_process: Beneficiaries are identified from SECC-2011 data and verified by Gram Sabha. Apply through the AwaasSoft portal or at the Gram Panchayat office.

name: Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana - Urban
description: Provides affordable housing to urban poor through credit-linked subsidy, in-situ slum redevelopment, and affordable housing in partnership.
ministry: Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs

benefits.amount: Interest subsidy of 3% to 6.5% on home loans up to ₹6 lakh for EWS/LIG and up to ₹12 lakh for MIG

documents_required: Affidavit of not owning a pucca house
application_process: Apply online through PMAY-U portal or at Common Service Centres. Applications can also be submitted at Urban Local Body offices.

name: Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana
description: Provides free LPG connections to women from BPL households to replace unclean cooking fuels with clean LPG fuel.
ministry: Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas

benefits.amount: Free LPG connection with a financial assistance of ₹1,600 per connection, including security deposit for cylinder and pressure regulator

application_process: Apply at the nearest LPG distributor with required documents. Verification is done against SECC-2011 data or through other eligible categories.

name: Ayushman Bharat - Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana
name_hi: आयुष्मान भारत - प्रधानमंत्री जन आरोग्य योजना
description: Provides health insurance coverage of ₹5 lakh per family per year for secondary and tertiary care hospitalization to economically vulnerable families.
ministry: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare

benefits.amount: Health insurance coverage of ₹5,00,000 per family per year covering hospitalization expenses for over 1,500 medical procedures

application_process: Check eligibility at mera.pmjay.gov.in or by calling 14555. Visit empanelled hospital or Common Service Centre to get Ayushman Card created.

name: Pradhan Mantri Jan Dhan Yojana
description: National mission for financial inclusion ensuring access to financial services such as bank accounts, remittance, credit, insurance, and pension.
ministry: Ministry of Finance

benefits.amount: Zero balance bank account with RuPay debit card, accidental insurance cover of ₹2 lakh, life insurance cover of ₹30,000, and overdraft facility up to ₹10,000

application_process: Visit any bank branch or Banking Correspondent outlet. Fill the account opening form and submit KYC documents. Small accounts can be opened with self-certification.

name: Sukanya Samriddhi Yojana
description: Small savings scheme for the girl child that offers high interest rate and tax benefits to encourage parents to save for their daughter's education and marriage.
ministry: Ministry of Finance

benefits.amount: High interest rate (currently ~8%) on deposits with tax exemption under Section 80C; minimum deposit ₹250 per year, maximum ₹1,50,000 per year

application_process: Open an account at any authorized bank branch or post office by filling the application form with required documents and initial deposit.

name: Pradhan Mantri Mudra Yojana
description: Provides micro-loans up to ₹10 lakh to non-corporate, non-farm small and micro enterprises for income-generating activities.
ministry: Ministry of Finance

benefits.amount: Loans in three categories: Shishu (up to ₹50,000), Kishore (₹50,001 to ₹5,00,000), and Tarun (₹5,00,001 to ₹10,00,000)

application_process: Apply at any commercial bank, RRB, small finance bank, cooperative bank, MFI, or NBFC. Submit application form with business plan and required documents.

name: Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana
description: Crop insurance scheme providing financial support to farmers suffering crop loss or damage due to natural calamities, pests, and diseases.
ministry: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

benefits.amount: Insurance coverage for crop loss with farmer premium of 2% for Kharif, 1.5% for Rabi, and 5% for commercial/horticulture crops; remaining premium paid by government

application_process: Apply online through the PMFBY portal or through the nearest bank branch, Common Service Centre, or authorized insurance company agent before the cut-off date.

name: Pradhan Mantri Jeevan Jyoti Bima Yojana
description: Renewable one-year life insurance scheme offering coverage for death due to any reason at a very affordable premium of ₹436 per annum.
ministry: Ministry of Finance

benefits.amount: Life insurance cover of ₹2,00,000 in case of death due to any reason at an annual premium of ₹436

application_process: Enroll through your bank branch by filling the consent-cum-declaration form. Premium is auto-debited from the bank account annually.

name: Pradhan Mantri Suraksha Bima Yojana
description: Accidental insurance scheme providing coverage for death or disability due to accident at an affordable premium of ₹20 per annum.
ministry: Ministry of Finance

benefits.amount: ₹2,00,000 for accidental death or total permanent disability; ₹1,00,000 for partial permanent disability at annual premium of ₹20

application_process: Enroll through your bank branch or online banking portal by filling the consent-cum-declaration form. Premium is auto-debited from the bank account annually.

name: Atal Pension Yojana
description: Pension scheme for workers in the unorganized sector providing guaranteed minimum pension of ₹1,000 to ₹5,000 per month after age 60.
ministry: Ministry of Finance

benefits.amount: Guaranteed monthly pension of ₹1,000 to ₹5,000 after attaining age 60, based on contribution amount and age of joining

application_process: Visit any bank branch where you have a savings account and fill the APY registration form. Contributions are auto-debited monthly/quarterly/half-yearly.

name: Deendayal Antyodaya Yojana - National Rural Livelihood Mission
name_hi: दीनदयाल अंत्योदय योजना - राष्ट्रीय ग्रामीण आजीविका मिशन
description: Aims to reduce rural poverty by enabling poor households to access gainful self-employment and skilled wage employment through Self Help Groups (SHGs).
ministry: Ministry of Rural Development

benefits.amount: Revolving fund of ₹10,000-₹15,000 per SHG; Community Investment Fund up to ₹2,50,000 per SHG; bank linkage support and interest subvention

application_process: Join or form a Self Help Group (SHG) at the village level. SHGs are supported by Community Resource Persons and Block/District Mission Management Units.

name: Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Anna Yojana
description: Provides free foodgrains (5 kg per person per month) to all beneficiaries covered under the National Food Security Act.
ministry: Ministry of Consumer Affairs, Food and Public Distribution

benefits.amount: 5 kg of free foodgrains (rice or wheat) per person per month to all NFSA beneficiary households

documents_required: Ration Card (Priority Household or Antyodaya Anna Yojana)
application_process: Eligible beneficiaries identified through existing NFSA ration card database. Collect foodgrains from the designated Fair Price Shop using Aadhaar-based authentication.

name: National Food Security Act
description: Provides subsidized foodgrains to approximately two-thirds of India's population, covering 75% rural and 50% urban households.
ministry: Ministry of Consumer Affairs, Food and Public Distribution

benefits.amount: 5 kg of foodgrains per person per month at subsidized prices: rice at ₹3/kg, wheat at ₹2/kg, coarse grains at ₹1/kg; Antyodaya households get 35 kg per family

application_process: Apply for a ration card at the district Food and Civil Supplies office or through the state food portal. After verification, ration card is issued for collecting foodgrains.

name: Pradhan Mantri Matru Vandana Yojana
description: Maternity benefit programme providing cash incentive of ₹5,000 in three installments to pregnant and lactating women for the first living child.
ministry: Ministry of Women and Child Development

benefits.amount: ₹5,000 in three installments: ₹1,000 on early registration, ₹2,000 after 6 months of pregnancy, ₹2,000 after child birth registration and first cycle of vaccination

documents_required: MCP Card (Mother and Child Protection Card)
application_process: Register at the nearest Anganwadi Centre or approved health facility. Fill the prescribed forms (1A, 1B, 1C) for each installment claim.

name: Beti Bachao Beti Padhao
description: Campaign to address declining child sex ratio and promote education and empowerment of the girl child through awareness and multi-sectoral interventions.
ministry: Ministry of Women and Child Development

benefits.amount: Awareness campaigns, community mobilization, training of stakeholders, and convergent efforts for girl child survival, protection, and education

application_process: This is primarily an awareness campaign. Benefits are delivered through convergence with existing schemes. Contact the District Programme Officer or local Anganwadi Centre.

name: Stand Up India
description: Facilitates bank loans between ₹10 lakh and ₹1 crore to at least one SC/ST borrower and one woman borrower per bank branch for setting up greenfield enterprises.
ministry: Ministry of Finance

benefits.amount: Composite loan of ₹10 lakh to ₹1 crore for greenfield enterprise in manufacturing, services, or trading sector with repayment period up to 7 years

application_process: Apply online through Stand Up India portal or visit the nearest bank branch. SIDBI's Stand Up Connect portal facilitates handholding support for applicants.

name: Startup India
description: Flagship initiative to build a strong ecosystem for nurturing innovation and startups, providing tax benefits, easier compliance, and funding support.
ministry: Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade (DPIIT)

benefits.amount: Tax exemption for 3 consecutive years, self-certification for compliance, fast-track patent applications, Fund of Funds with corpus of ₹10,000 crore

application_process: Register on the Startup India portal and apply for DPIIT recognition. Submit application with details of innovation and business plan for recognition certificate.

name: Pradhan Mantri Street Vendor's AtmaNirbhar Nidhi
description: Micro-credit facility providing affordable working capital loans to street vendors to resume their livelihood activities after COVID-19 lockdown.
ministry: Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs

benefits.amount: Working capital loan: first tranche ₹10,000, second tranche ₹20,000, third tranche ₹50,000 with 7% interest subsidy on timely repayment

documents_required: Vending Certificate/Letter of Recommendation from ULB
application_process: Apply online through PM SVANidhi portal or mobile app. Applications can also be submitted through Common Service Centres or lending institutions.

name: PM Vishwakarma
description: End-to-end support to traditional artisans and craftspeople through skills training, toolkit incentives, credit support, and market linkage for 18 traditional trades.
ministry: Ministry of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises

benefits.amount: Skills training with stipend of ₹500/day, toolkit incentive of ₹15,000, collateral-free loans up to ₹3 lakh at 5% interest, digital transaction incentive, and marketing support

application_process: Register through PM Vishwakarma portal with Aadhaar-based biometric verification at Common Service Centres. Gram Panchayat/ULB verifies the artisan/craftsperson status.

name: National Apprenticeship Promotion Scheme
description: Promotes apprenticeship training in establishments by sharing 25% of prescribed stipend with employers, subject to a maximum of ₹1,500 per month per apprentice.
ministry: Ministry of Skill Development and Entrepreneurship

benefits.amount: Government shares 25% of prescribed stipend (max ₹1,500/month) with employer; apprentices receive on-the-job training and certification

application_process: Register as an apprentice on the apprenticeshipindia.gov.in portal. Search and apply for apprenticeship opportunities. Employer approves and training begins.

name: Pradhan Mantri Kaushal Vikas Yojana
description: Flagship skill development scheme enabling Indian youth to take up industry-relevant skill training and become employable, with free short-term training and certification.
ministry: Ministry of Skill Development and Entrepreneurship

benefits.amount: Free short-term skill training (150-300 hours) with certification, assessment fee reimbursement, and placement assistance; training cost of ₹10,000-₹15,000 borne by government

application_process: Register on Skill India portal or visit the nearest PMKVY Training Centre. Enroll in a preferred skill course, complete training and assessment to receive certification.

name: Samagra Shiksha Abhiyan
description: Integrated scheme for school education covering pre-school to class XII, aiming to ensure inclusive and equitable quality education with improved learning outcomes.
ministry: Ministry of Education

benefits.amount: Free textbooks, uniforms, transport allowance for students; school infrastructure development, teacher training, ICT-based education, and inclusive education support

application_process: Benefits are provided through the school system. Students enrolled in government and government-aided schools automatically receive benefits. Contact the school or District Education Office.

name: PM POSHAN (Mid-Day Meal Scheme)
description: Provides free hot cooked meals to children in government and government-aided schools to enhance enrollment, attendance, retention, and nutritional levels.
ministry: Ministry of Education

benefits.amount: Free cooked meal every school day providing 450 calories and 12g protein (primary) or 700 calories and 20g protein (upper primary) per child

application_process: All children enrolled in classes I to VIII in government and government-aided schools are automatically eligible. No separate application required.

name: Prime Minister's Scholarship Scheme
description: Provides scholarships to dependent wards and widows of ex-servicemen and ex-coast guard personnel for pursuing professional and technical education.
ministry: Ministry of Defence

benefits.amount: ₹3,000 per month for boys and ₹3,600 per month for girls pursuing professional degree courses like MBBS, engineering, MBA, etc.

application_process: Apply online through the Kendriya Sainik Board (KSB) portal. Applications are verified by the Zila Sainik Board and forwarded to KSB for approval.

name: Swachh Bharat Mission - Gramin
description: Aims to achieve universal sanitation coverage in rural India by constructing household and community toilets and promoting behavioral change for open defecation free status.
ministry: Ministry of Jal Shakti

benefits.amount: ₹12,000 incentive for construction of individual household latrine (IHHL) including water supply and hand-washing facility

application_process: Apply at the Gram Panchayat office or through the SBM-G portal. Gram Panchayat verifies eligibility and sanctions construction. Incentive released after verification of toilet construction.

name: Jal Jeevan Mission
description: Aims to provide functional household tap connections (FHTC) to every rural household, ensuring potable water supply of 55 litres per capita per day.
ministry: Ministry of Jal Shakti

benefits.amount: Functional household tap connection providing potable water at 55 litres per capita per day, with priority to quality-affected areas and SC/ST habitations

application_process: Implemented as a community-driven programme through Gram Panchayats and Village Water and Sanitation Committees (VWSC). Contact Gram Panchayat for inclusion.

name: Pradhan Mantri Sahaj Bijli Har Ghar Yojana (Saubhagya)
name_hi: प्रधानमंत्री सहज बिजली हर घर योजना (सौभाग्य)
description: Provides free electricity connections to all un-electrified households in rural and urban areas to achieve universal household electrification.
ministry: Ministry of Power

benefits.amount: Free electricity connection including LED bulbs, wiring, and meter for BPL households; connection at ₹500 for APL households payable in 10 installments

application_process: Apply at the nearest electricity distribution company office or through camps organized in villages. SECC-2011 data is used to identify un-electrified BPL households.

name: Soil Health Card Scheme
description: Provides soil health cards to farmers carrying crop-wise recommendations on nutrients and fertilizers required for individual farms to improve soil health and productivity.
ministry: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

benefits.amount: Free Soil Health Card issued every 2 years with details of soil nutrient status and crop-wise fertilizer recommendations for 12 parameters

application_process: Register at the local agriculture office or through the Soil Health Card portal. Soil samples are collected from the farm, tested in labs, and the card is generated.

name: Mission for Integrated Development of Horticulture
description: Promotes holistic growth of the horticulture sector through area-based regionally differentiated strategies covering fruits, vegetables, flowers, spices, and plantation crops.
ministry: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

benefits.amount: Subsidies of 40%-75% on planting material, drip irrigation, protected cultivation, cold storage, and post-harvest management infrastructure

application_process: Apply through the state horticulture department or online through the Hortnet portal. District level committee approves proposals based on area plans.

name: Rashtriya Krishi Vikas Yojana
description: Incentivizes states to increase public investment in agriculture and allied sectors by providing flexible funding for locally relevant agriculture development projects.
ministry: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

benefits.amount: Project-based funding for agriculture infrastructure, agri-business development, and value chain projects with up to 50%-70% subsidy on project cost

application_process: Submit project proposals through state agriculture departments. Projects are approved by State Level Sanctioning Committee (SLSC) based on district agriculture plans.

name: e-Shram
description: National database for unorganized workers including construction workers, migrants, gig workers, and domestic workers, providing a Universal Account Number (UAN) and social security benefits.
ministry: Ministry of Labour and Employment

benefits.amount: e-Shram card with UAN, accidental insurance cover of ₹2 lakh (death) and ₹1 lakh (partial disability) under PMSBY, and linkage to social security schemes

application_process: Register online at eshram.gov.in or through Common Service Centres using Aadhaar-based e-KYC. Self-registration available via mobile app or web portal.

name: Prime Minister's Employment Generation Programme
description: Generates employment opportunities in rural and urban areas through establishment of micro enterprises in non-farm sector with margin money subsidy.
ministry: Ministry of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises

benefits.amount: Margin money subsidy of 15%-35% of project cost for manufacturing (up to ₹50 lakh) and service (up to ₹20 lakh) enterprises; higher subsidy for SC/ST/women/minorities

application_process: Apply online through the KVIC (Khadi and Village Industries Commission) portal. Applications are screened by District Task Force Committee and forwarded to banks for financing.

name: Deen Dayal Upadhyaya Grameen Kaushalya Yojana
name_hi: दीन दयाल उपाध्याय ग्रामीण कौशल्य योजना
description: Skill training and placement programme for rural youth from poor families, providing free training, certification, and guaranteed placement with minimum wages.
ministry: Ministry of Rural Development

benefits.amount: Free skill training (576-2304 hours) with boarding, lodging, and post-placement support; minimum 70% placement guarantee with CTC of ₹6,000+ per month

application_process: Register through Gram Panchayat or Block office. Select preferred training programme and training partner. Mobilization is done through community-based organizations.

name: Integrated Child Development Services
description: Provides a package of six services including supplementary nutrition, immunization, health check-ups, referral services, nutrition education, and pre-school education to children under 6 and pregnant/lactating mothers.
ministry: Ministry of Women and Child Development

benefits.amount: Supplementary nutrition (500 calories for children, 600 calories for pregnant/lactating women), immunization, health check-ups, pre-school education, and referral services

application_process: Visit the nearest Anganwadi Centre for registration. Services are provided through the network of Anganwadi Centres across the country.

name: National Social Assistance Programme
description: Social assistance programme providing pensions and benefits to elderly, widows, and persons with disabilities from BPL households through multiple sub-schemes.
ministry: Ministry of Rural Development

benefits.amount: Monthly pension ranging from ₹200 to ₹500 under various sub-schemes (IGNOAPS, IGNWPS, IGNDPS); ₹20,000 lump sum under NFBS for death of primary breadwinner

application_process: Apply at the Gram Panchayat or Block Development Office. Applications are verified at district level and pensions are disbursed through bank/post office accounts.

name: Indira Gandhi National Old Age Pension Scheme
name_hi: इंदिरा गांधी राष्ट्रीय वृद्धावस्था पेंशन योजना
description: Provides monthly pension to elderly persons aged 60 years and above belonging to BPL households to ensure minimum social security in old age.
ministry: Ministry of Rural Development

benefits.amount: ₹200 per month for persons aged 60-79 years; ₹500 per month for persons aged 80 years and above (central share; states may add top-up)

application_process: Apply at the Gram Panchayat or Block Development Office. Verification is done by concerned authorities and pension is disbursed through bank/post office accounts.

name: Indira Gandhi National Widow Pension Scheme
name_hi: इंदिरा गांधी राष्ट्रीय विधवा पेंशन योजना
description: Provides monthly pension to widows aged 40-79 years belonging to BPL households to support their livelihood and ensure social security.
ministry: Ministry of Rural Development

benefits.amount: ₹300 per month (central share; states may add top-up amount)

application_process: Apply at the Gram Panchayat or Block Development Office with required documents. Verification is done at district level and pension is disbursed through bank/post office.

name: National Family Benefit Scheme
description: Provides a lump sum financial assistance to the bereaved household on the death of the primary breadwinner in the age group of 18-59 years from a BPL family.
ministry: Ministry of Rural Development

benefits.amount: Lump sum assistance of ₹20,000 to the bereaved household on death of the primary breadwinner

documents_required: FIR/Medical Report (in case of unnatural death)
application_process: Apply at the Block Development Office or District Social Welfare Office within one year of death of the breadwinner. Verification and disbursement done at district level.

name: Pradhan Mantri Surakshit Matritva Abhiyan
description: Provides free antenatal care to pregnant women on the 9th of every month, ensuring quality check-ups by specialist doctors including high-risk pregnancy identification.
ministry: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare

benefits.amount: Free comprehensive antenatal check-up on 9th of every month including ultrasound, blood tests, urine tests, and specialist consultation for high-risk pregnancy identification

documents_required: MCP Card (Mother and Child Protection Card)
application_process: Visit the nearest government health facility on the 9th of every month during pregnancy. Carry MCP card for recording check-up details.

name: Janani Suraksha Yojana
description: Cash assistance scheme to promote institutional delivery among pregnant women from BPL families by providing cash incentives for delivering at health facilities.
ministry: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare

benefits.amount: Cash assistance of ₹1,400 in rural areas and ₹1,000 in urban areas for institutional delivery; ₹500 for home delivery in LPS states; ASHA incentive of ₹600

application_process: Register with the local ASHA worker or at the nearest government health facility during pregnancy. Cash benefit is disbursed at the time of institutional delivery.

name: Mission Indradhanush (Immunization)
description: Intensified immunization drive to achieve full immunization coverage of all children under 2 years and pregnant women with all available vaccines under the Universal Immunization Programme.
ministry: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare

benefits.amount: Free vaccination against 12 vaccine-preventable diseases including tuberculosis, polio, hepatitis B, diphtheria, pertussis, tetanus, measles, rubella, and pneumonia

application_process: Visit the nearest government health facility, sub-centre, or Anganwadi centre on designated immunization days. ASHA workers also conduct door-to-door mobilization.

name: National Health Mission
description: Umbrella programme strengthening healthcare delivery across rural and urban India through free essential healthcare services, infrastructure, and human resource development.
ministry: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare

benefits.amount: Free essential healthcare services at public health facilities including maternal health, child health, communicable disease treatment, and free drugs and diagnostics

application_process: Visit the nearest government health facility (Sub-Centre, PHC, CHC, District Hospital) for availing free healthcare services. No separate registration required for most services.

name: Rashtriya Swasthya Bima Yojana
description: Health insurance scheme for BPL families providing cashless hospitalization coverage, now largely subsumed under Ayushman Bharat but still operational in some states.
ministry: Ministry of Labour and Employment

benefits.amount: Health insurance coverage of ₹30,000 per family per year for hospitalization with cashless treatment at empanelled hospitals; covers up to 5 family members

application_process: Enrollment is done through camps organized by insurance companies in coordination with district administration. Smart card is issued for cashless hospitalization.

name: Pradhan Mantri Gram Sadak Yojana
description: Provides all-weather road connectivity to unconnected rural habitations with population of 500+ (250+ in hilly/tribal areas) and upgrades existing rural roads.
ministry: Ministry of Rural Development

benefits.amount: All-weather road connectivity to eligible unconnected habitations; road length constructed as per PMGSY standards with 5-year maintenance provision

application_process: This is an infrastructure scheme implemented by state governments. Proposals are prepared by state-level agencies and approved by the National Rural Roads Development Agency (NRRDA).

name: Digital India Programme
description: Transformative programme to digitally empower citizens by ensuring digital infrastructure, digital literacy, and delivery of government services electronically.
ministry: Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology

benefits.amount: Digital infrastructure (broadband, mobile connectivity), digital literacy training through PMGDISHA, e-governance services, and Common Service Centres in rural areas

application_process: Access digital services through Common Service Centres, government portals, or mobile apps. For PMGDISHA digital literacy training, register at the nearest CSC.

name: Pradhan Mantri Krishi Sinchai Yojana
description: Ensures access to protective irrigation to every farm (Har Khet Ko Paani) and improves water use efficiency through micro-irrigation (Per Drop More Crop).
ministry: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare

benefits.amount: 55% subsidy on micro-irrigation (drip/sprinkler) for small/marginal farmers and 45% for other farmers; additional 10% for AERU projects through NABARD

application_process: Apply through the state agriculture/horticulture department or online through the PMKSY portal. District level committee approves applications based on scheme guidelines.

name: National Rural Drinking Water Programme
description: Provides safe and adequate drinking water to all rural populations, now subsumed under Jal Jeevan Mission with focus on piped water supply to every household.
ministry: Ministry of Jal Shakti

benefits.amount: Safe drinking water supply infrastructure including hand pumps, piped water systems, water purification plants, and water quality monitoring in rural habitations

application_process: Implemented through state Public Health Engineering Departments and Gram Panchayats. Community participation through Village Water and Sanitation Committees (VWSC).
